alert.note: Alert for Laurel; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 10:12PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Laurel, northeastern Pulaski and southwestern Rockcastle Counties through 1045 PM EDT... At 1011 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Valley Oak, or 11 miles northeast of Somerset, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bloss and Hansford around 1020 PM EDT. Billows, Pongo and Luner around 1025 PM EDT. Bunch and Hazel Patch around 1030 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Bernstadt, Carmichael, Wood Creek Lake, Hare, London, Pittsburg, East Bernstadt, Levi Jackson S.P., London-Corbin Airport, Sublimity City, Fariston and Maplesville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for south central and southeastern Kentucky.
